title: Dynamic Programming
concept: This level focuses on solving problems using DP — memoization, tabulation, optimal substructure, overlapping subproblems, 1-D and 2-D DP tables, LIS, knapsack, coin change and grid-based DP.

challenges.title: Fibonacci (DP - Tabulation)
challenges.description: Given N, print the Nth Fibonacci number using DP (bottom-up).
challenges.starterCode: // dp[0]=0, dp[1]=1, fill up to n

challenges.title: Climbing Stairs
challenges.description: You can climb 1 or 2 steps. Count ways to reach Nth stair using DP.

challenges.title: Min Cost Climbing Stairs
challenges.description: Given cost of each step, find min cost to reach the top. (Either index n or n-1 is the top.)

challenges.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS - O(N²))
challenges.description: Print length of LIS using DP.
challenges.starterCode: // dp[i] = 1 + max(dp[j]) for j<i and arr[j]<arr[i]

challenges.title: 0/1 Knapsack
challenges.description: Given N items with weight and value, and capacity W, print max value obtainable.

challenges.title: Coin Change — Total Ways
challenges.description: Count ways to make sum X using unlimited coins (order doesn't matter).

challenges.title: Subset Sum (DP)
challenges.description: Given N numbers and sum K, print Yes if subset sums to K else No using DP.

challenges.title: Edit Distance (Levenshtein)
challenges.description: Given strings S and T, find minimum operations to convert S → T (insert/delete/replace).

challenges.title: Grid Path — Min Cost Path
challenges.description: Given grid of costs N×M, start at (0,0) and reach (N−1,M−1) with only right/down. Print minimum total cost.

challenges.title: Longest Common Subsequence (LCS)
challenges.description: Given strings A and B, print length of LCS using DP.
challenges.starterCode: // dp[i][j] = 1 + dp[i-1][j-1] when match else max of remove
